title_sort: william e. vandemark to walt whitman, 25 december 1863
title: William E. Vandemark to Walt Whitman, 25 December 1863
text: Dear fatheri[I] now take the plesure[pleasure] of writing a few lines yo[you] hoping they find yo[you] well i[I] am quite well and in the convalesent[convalescent] Camp i long to see yo and have a talk with yo thair[] hante[haven't] inny[any] news here we had a good dinner here to dayfather[Father]yo[you] must excuse me for not writing a long letter for my hand trembls[trembles] so that i[I] cant[can't] write well father write to me and if yo[you] can come and see me good by for this time from Wm E Vandemark to friend Walt Whitmani[I] am in barick[barrack] 43 Addres[Address] Camp Convalesint[Convalescent] Elickazandry[Alexandria] [Soldiers nicknamed Alexandria "Camp Misery".] William E. Vandemark to Walt Whitman, 25 December 1863
